result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Angela Wang
Protective Order
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on February 22, 2022.
Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nathan A Taylor
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 02-22-2022)
Prior: 1423 Fleetfoot Dr, Waukesha, WI 53186

Protective Order
The original document name was titled: Proposed Order
The original history event date is: 02-22-2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18 and never in a private location, codefendant can not be a supervisor of contact with minor children.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant is prohibited from accessing any child exploitation material and any other sexually explicit material through the Internet or by any other means.  Defendant prohibited from contacting a minor over the internet or using a website to gather information about a minor. Defendant is prohibited from intentionally deleting any history from any computer or device that accesses the Internet. Defendant prohibited from using any application where the content automatically deletes upon the recipient opening the content.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.   CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victims, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.    Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victims listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Receipt of Passport surrendered to the Court.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

02:53 PM Defendant Nathan A Taylor in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and victim key and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.    Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Court questions the parents of the victim being included on the victim key and complaince with victim notification.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
